dimes.measurements.nio
Class MacLevelNetworkStack

java.lang.Object
  dimes.measurements.nio.NetworkStack
      dimes.measurements.nio.MacLevelNetworkStack
All Implemented Interfaces:
dimes.measurements.nio.NativeLogger
public class MacLevelNetworkStack
extends dimes.measurements.nio.NetworkStack
implements dimes.measurements.nio.NativeLogger

Author:
Ohad Serfaty

a raw socket network stack for the usage of mac level measurements

Please note that this class is a singleton and can be accessed only threw the getInstance() function.

setCallbackBufferSize

public void setCallbackBufferSize(int size)
Description copied from class: dimes.measurements.nio.NetworkStack

Set the size of the PacketBuffer. when a receive() method is called with a non-null buffer , it will perform a callback after accumulating this number of packets. Default size is 10 packets.

Specified by:
setCallbackBufferSize in class dimes.measurements.nio.NetworkStack
Parameters:
size - number of packets to buffer before calling 'callback'

receive

public void receive(long listenTimeout,
                    dimes.measurements.nio.packet.PacketBuffer buffer,
                    dimes.measurements.nio.CallbackContext context)
             throws dimes.measurements.nio.error.MeasurementException
Description copied from class: dimes.measurements.nio.NetworkStack

When one of the parameters is null , this function acts like the on of the subsequent receive() functions.

When both buffer and context are not null , the function will listen until the buffer is full and then perform a callback.

Specified by:
receive in class dimes.measurements.nio.NetworkStack
Parameters:
listenTimeout - time to listen
buffer - a buffer to fill packets with
context - callback context
Throws:
dimes.measurements.nio.error.MeasurementException

setPacketFilter

public void setPacketFilter(int[][] filterPattern)

Set a coded Packet filter. Packet filters are bpf programs (Berkeley Packet Filter ) , which are generated by a tcpdump or windump application

Parameters:
filterPattern - a filter pattern int[][] array

openListener

public void openListener()

Open the listener for incoming packets. Use this function before you use the receive() function to mark the point where the stack is open for packets.

setPacketFilter

public void setPacketFilter(dimes.measurements.nio.packet.CodedPacketFilter filter)
Set a coded Packet filter. Packet filters are bpf programs (Berkeley Packet Filter ) , which are generated by a tcpdump or windump application

Parameters:
filter - a pre made filter
See Also:
CodedPacketFilter
